SEARCH

Class ImperfectMazeKruskal

java.lang.Object
ImperfectMazeKruskal
public class ImperfectMazeKruskal extends Object
This class ImperfectMazeKruskal extends PerfectMaze and creates an imperfect maze using Kruskal's algorithm first to generate a perfect maze. After generating the perfect maze, it randomly removes and adds walls to create loops and more complexity, so the maze is not perfect anymore.

  • Constructor Details

    • ImperfectMazeKruskal

      public ImperfectMazeKruskal(int x, int y, int seed, int[] start, int[] end)
      Constructor to create an imperfect maze with Kruskal algorithm. It calls the superclass constructor to create maze basics, then generate a perfect maze with Kruskal method, and finally remove and add random walls.
      Parameters:
      x - width of the maze
      y - height of the maze
      seed - random seed for maze generation
      start - start point coordinates
      end - end point coordinates

  • Method Details

    • get_last_node

      public Node get_last_node()
      Returns the last node visited during DFS generation.
      Returns:
      last node object

    • generate_dfs_next_step

      public boolean generate_dfs_next_step()
      Performs one step of DFS maze generation. Returns true if generation is finished. Finished means we are back to depth 0 and no unvisited neighbors.
      Returns:
      true if maze generation finished, false otherwise

    • generateBFS

      public void generateBFS()
      Run the full DFS maze generation until finished.

    • generateKruskal

      public void generateKruskal()
      Generates the maze using Kruskal's algorithm. Each node is initially in its own set with a unique depth. Then randomly connects nodes with different depths and merges their sets by updating depth. Repeats until all nodes have same depth (one connected set).

    • get_adjacency_list

      public Map<Node,List<Node>> get_adjacency_list()

    • displayTextMaze

      public void displayTextMaze()
      Prints a text representation of the maze to the console. Uses colors for start (green), end (red), path (purple), visited nodes (white). Walls are represented by ///.

    • removeRandomWalls

      public void removeRandomWalls(int max)
      Randomly removes up to max walls by adding edges between unconnected nodes.
      Parameters:
      max - maximum number of walls to remove

    • addRandomWalls

      public void addRandomWalls(int max)
      Randomly adds up to max walls by removing edges between connected nodes.
      Parameters:
      max - maximum number of walls to add

    • save_maze

      public void save_maze(String save_name)
      Saves the maze data into a file in folder "backup". Format: - First line: size_x size_y - Second line: seed - Third line: startX startY endX endY - Following lines: edges as "x1 y1 x2 y2"
      Parameters:
      save_name - file name to save the maze data

    • restore_maze

      public void restore_maze(String save_name)
      Restore maze data from a saved file in folder "backup". Reads size, seed, start/end, and edges.
      Parameters:
      save_name - file name to restore from
